intro: Copisma effusum, commonly known as the smoothleaf sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to wetland habitats in North America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, rushes, and similar plants. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are smooth and grass-like, with a distinctive cylindrical stem. Copisma effusum produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets, which are typical of the sedge family.
